comments.body: Please keep using `make -j2` unless we know that not doing so is actually causing us trouble
This has been causing us trouble. And as of b3ae9150de99a9b7b92ceddb11cd9e43ea92c7cb is on par with our CI settings.

@refack I don’t really know the context of the failure, but is this related to Travis specifically? My impression would be that this means that `make -jN` is potentially broken everywhere? And if that is the case, is this here a temporary workaround for that issue?

@addaleax 

> My impression would be that this means that `make -jN` is potentially broken everywhere? 

It is for me. The breakage is even easier to reproduce with V8 7.1 (because more actions are executed with GYP).
Relanding https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/23257 would fix it, but breaks rebuilds on macOS (see https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/23423#issuecomment-432241209)

@refack If this is accurate (i.e. this is only a temporary workaround), feel free to add me as a reviewer. I’d appreciate having some mention of why we do this, both the compiler change and the `-j1` parts, in the commit message, if that’s okay with you.

We should reconsider after we solve the make cyclic dependency.
(Again IMHO `make test -j2` doesn't give use much benefit in terms on time, maybe otherwise.)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +25,29 @@        - make -j2 V=
      script:
        - PARALLEL_ARGS='--flaky-tests=skip' make -j1 test
